subject: Cybersecurity
title: WannaCry: The Ransomware That Stopped Hospitals
description: A quick win: understand WannaCry: The Ransomware That Stopped Hospitals.

hook.text: In May 2017, hospitals across Britain couldn't access patient records. Surgeries were canceled. Ambulances diverted.

buildup.text: WannaCry used EternalBlue, an NSA exploit leaked by the Shadow Brokers, to spread across Windows networks.

discovery.text: It encrypted files on 230,000 computers in 150 countries within a single day, demanding Bitcoin ransom.

twist.text: A 22-year-old researcher found a kill switch â€” a domain name in the code. Registering it stopped the spread.

climax.text: WannaCry showed that hoarding exploits is dangerous: the NSA's own weapon was turned against the world.

punchline.text: A $10 domain registration stopped a global cyber attack.

quiz.question: What NSA exploit did WannaCry use to spread?
